00067 L_Alloc_Pool *CHAR_ARRAY_Symbol_Table_pool = NULL;
00068 L_Alloc_Pool *CHAR_ARRAY_Symbol_pool = NULL;

00071  ****
00072  **** CHAR_ARRAY routines

00075 
00076 /* Create and initialize CHAR_ARRAY_Symbol_Table.
00077  * Creates a hash table of initial size 2 * expected_size rounded up
00078  * to the closest power of two.  (Min hash size 32)
00079  */
00080 CHAR_ARRAY_Symbol_Table *
00081 CHAR_ARRAY_new_symbol_table (char *name, int expected_size)
00082 {
00083   CHAR_ARRAY_Symbol_Table *table;
00084   CHAR_ARRAY_Symbol **hash;
00085   unsigned int min_size, hash_size;
00086   int i;
00087 
00088   /* If expected size negative, force to be 0 */
00089   if (expected_size < 0)
00090     expected_size = 0;
00091 
00092   /* To prevent infinite loop by sizing algorithm (and running out of
00093    * memory :) ), expected_size must be <= a billion.
00094    */
00095   if (expected_size > 1000000000)
00096     I_punt ("CHAR_ARRAY_Symbol_Table: unreasonable expected_size (%u)",
00097             expected_size);
00098 
00099   /* Want a minumum size of at least twice the expected size */
00100   min_size = expected_size * 2;
00101 
00102   /* Start with a minumum hash size of 32.  
00103    * (Smaller sizes don't work as well with the hashing algorithm)
00104    */
00105   hash_size = 32;
00106 
00107   /* Double hash_size until min_size is reached or exceeded */
00108   while (hash_size < min_size)
00109     hash_size = hash_size << 1;
00110 
00111 
00112   /* Create new symbol table pool (and symbol pool if necessary) */
00113   if (CHAR_ARRAY_Symbol_Table_pool == NULL)
00114     {
00115       CHAR_ARRAY_Symbol_Table_pool =
00116         L_create_alloc_pool ("CHAR_ARRAY_Symbol_Table",
00117                              sizeof (CHAR_ARRAY_Symbol_Table), 16);
00118 
00119       CHAR_ARRAY_Symbol_pool =
00120         L_create_alloc_pool ("CHAR_ARRAY_Symbol",
00121                              sizeof (CHAR_ARRAY_Symbol), 64);
00122     }
00123 
00124   /* Allocate symbol table */
00125   table = (CHAR_ARRAY_Symbol_Table *) L_alloc (CHAR_ARRAY_Symbol_Table_pool);
00126 
00127   /* Allocate array for hash */
00128   hash = (CHAR_ARRAY_Symbol **) malloc (hash_size *
00129                                         sizeof (CHAR_ARRAY_Symbol *));
00130   if (hash == NULL)
00131     {
00132       I_punt ("CHAR_ARRAY_new_symbol_table: Out of memory, "
00133               "hash array size %i.", hash_size);
00134     }
00135 
00136   /* Initialize hash table */
00137   for (i = 0; i < hash_size; i++)
00138     hash[i] = NULL;
00139 
00140   /* Initialize fields */
00141   table->name = strdup (name);
00142   table->hash = hash;
00143   table->hash_size = hash_size;
00144   table->hash_mask = hash_size - 1;   /* AND mask, works only for power of 2 */
00145   /* Resize when count at 75% of hash_size */
00146   table->resize_size = hash_size - (hash_size >> 2);
00147   table->head_symbol = NULL;
00148   table->tail_symbol = NULL;
00149   table->symbol_count = 0;
00150 
00151   return (table);
00152 }
00153 
00154 /* Frees the symbol table, and optionally frees the data pointed to */
00155 void
00156 CHAR_ARRAY_delete_symbol_table (CHAR_ARRAY_Symbol_Table * table,
00157                                 void (*free_routine) (void *))
00158 {
00159   CHAR_ARRAY_Symbol *symbol, *next_symbol;
00160 
00161   /* For all the symbols in the table, free each one */
00162   for (symbol = table->head_symbol; symbol != NULL; symbol = next_symbol)
00163     {
00164       /* Get the next symbol before deleting this one */
00165       next_symbol = symbol->next_symbol;
00166 
00167       /* If free routine specified, free data */
00168       if (free_routine != NULL)
00169         free_routine (symbol->data);
00170 
00171       /* Free symbol structure and char_array */
00172       free (symbol->char_array);
00173       L_free (CHAR_ARRAY_Symbol_pool, symbol);
00174     }
00175 
00176   /* Free the hash array and table name */
00177   free (table->hash);
00178   free (table->name);
00179 
00180   /* Free the table structure */
00181   L_free (CHAR_ARRAY_Symbol_Table_pool, table);
00182 }
00183 
00184 /* Doubles the symbol table hash array size */
00185 void
00186 CHAR_ARRAY_resize_symbol_table (CHAR_ARRAY_Symbol_Table * table)
00187 {
00188   CHAR_ARRAY_Symbol **new_hash, *symbol, *hash_head;
00189   int new_hash_size;
00190   unsigned int new_hash_mask, new_hash_index;
00191   int i;
00192 
00193   /* Double the size of the hash array */
00194   new_hash_size = table->hash_size * 2;
00195 
00196   /* Allocate new hash array */
00197   new_hash = (CHAR_ARRAY_Symbol **) malloc (new_hash_size *
00198                                             sizeof (CHAR_ARRAY_Symbol *));
00199   if (new_hash == NULL)
00200     {
00201       I_punt ("CHAR_ARRAY_resize_symbol_table: Out of memory, new size %i.",
00202               new_hash_size);
00203     }
00204 
00205   /* Initialize new hash table */
00206   for (i = 0; i < new_hash_size; i++)
00207     new_hash[i] = NULL;
00208 
00209   /* Get the hash mask for the new hash table */
00210   new_hash_mask = new_hash_size - 1;  /* AND mask, works only for power of 2 */
00211 
00212   /* Go though all the symbol and add to new hash table.
00213    * Can totally disreguard old hash links.
00214    */
00215   for (symbol = table->head_symbol; symbol != NULL;
00216        symbol = symbol->next_symbol)
00217     {
00218       /* Get index into hash table to use for this char_array */
00219       new_hash_index = symbol->hash_val & new_hash_mask;
00220 
00221       /* Add symbol to head of linked list */
00222       hash_head = new_hash[new_hash_index];
00223       symbol->next_hash = hash_head;
00224       symbol->prev_hash = NULL;
00225       if (hash_head != NULL)
00226         hash_head->prev_hash = symbol;
00227       new_hash[new_hash_index] = symbol;
00228     }
00229 
00230   /* Free old hash table */
00231   free (table->hash);
00232 
00233   /* Initialize table fields for new hash table */
00234   table->hash = new_hash;
00235   table->hash_size = new_hash_size;
00236   table->hash_mask = new_hash_mask;
00237   /* Resize when count at 75% of new_hash_size */
00238   table->resize_size = new_hash_size - (new_hash_size >> 2);
00239 }
00240 
00241 /* Hashes a int array, returning an unsigned 32 bit number. */
00242 static unsigned int
00243 CHAR_ARRAY_hash_char_array (char *char_array, int array_length)
00244 {
00245   unsigned int hash_val;
00246   int i;
00247 
00248   hash_val = 0;
00249 
00250   /* Scan through the char_array, adding the ints to the
00251    * hash value.  Multiply the hash value by 17 (using shifts) before
00252    * adding each character in.
00253    *
00254    * This very quick hash algorithm was tuned to work well with
00255    * strings ending with numbers, but should work OK for char arrays as well.
00256    */
00257   for (i = 0; i < array_length; i++)
00258     {
00259       /* Multiply hash_val by 17 by adding 16*hash_val to it.
00260        * (Use a shift, integer multiply is usually very expensive)
00261        */
00262       hash_val += (hash_val << 4);
00263 
00264       /* Add in char_array value, cast unsigned to remove sign extension */
00265       hash_val += (unsigned char) char_array[i];
00266     }
00267 
00268   /* Return the hash value */
00269   return (hash_val);
00270 }
00271 
00272 
00273 /* Adds structure to symbol table, data is not copied (char_array is)!!! 
00274  * Dynamically increases symbol table's hash array.
00275  * Returns pointer to added symbol.
00276  */
00277 CHAR_ARRAY_Symbol *
00278 CHAR_ARRAY_add_symbol (CHAR_ARRAY_Symbol_Table * table,
00279                        char *char_array, int array_length, void *data)
00280 {
00281   CHAR_ARRAY_Symbol *symbol, *hash_head, *check_symbol, *tail_symbol;
00282   unsigned int hash_val, hash_index;
00283   int symbol_count, i, match;
00284 
00285   /* Sanity check, array_length must be >= 1 */
00286   if (array_length < 1)
00287     {
00288       I_punt ("CHAR_ARRAY_add_symbol: Error array_length (%i) < 1!",
00289               array_length);
00290     }
00291 
00292   /* Increase symbol table size if necessary before adding new symbol.  
00293    * This will change the hash_mask if the table is resized!
00294    */
00295   symbol_count = table->symbol_count;
00296   if (symbol_count >= table->resize_size)
00297     {
00298       CHAR_ARRAY_resize_symbol_table (table);
00299     }
00300 
00301   /* Allocate a symbol (pool initialized in create table routine) */
00302   symbol = (CHAR_ARRAY_Symbol *) L_alloc (CHAR_ARRAY_Symbol_pool);
00303 
00304   /* Alloc char_array and Initialize it and rest of fields */
00305   if ((symbol->char_array = (char *) malloc (array_length *
00306                                              sizeof (char))) == NULL)
00307     {
00308       I_punt ("CHAR_ARRAY_Symbol: Out of memory, char_array size %i",
00309               array_length * sizeof (char));
00310     }
00311   for (i = 0; i < array_length; i++)
00312     symbol->char_array[i] = char_array[i];
00313 
00314   symbol->array_length = array_length;
00315   symbol->data = data;
00316   symbol->table = table;
00317 
00318   /* Get tail symbol for ease of use */
00319   tail_symbol = table->tail_symbol;
00320 
00321   /* Add to linked list of symbols */
00322   symbol->next_symbol = NULL;
00323   symbol->prev_symbol = tail_symbol;
00324 
00325   if (tail_symbol == NULL)
00326     table->head_symbol = symbol;
00327   else
00328     tail_symbol->next_symbol = symbol;
00329   table->tail_symbol = symbol;
00330 
00331 
00332   /* Get hash value of char_array and put in symbol structure for 
00333    * quick compare and table resize.
00334    */
00335   hash_val = CHAR_ARRAY_hash_char_array (char_array, array_length);
00336   symbol->hash_val = hash_val;
00337 
00338   /* Get index into hash table */
00339   hash_index = hash_val & table->hash_mask;
00340 
00341   /* Get head symbol in current linked list for ease of use */
00342   hash_head = table->hash[hash_index];
00343 
00344 
00345   /* Sanity check (may want to ifdef out later).
00346 
00347    * Check that this symbol's char_array is not already in the symbol table.
00348    * Punt if it is, since can cause a major debugging nightmare.
00349    */
00350   for (check_symbol = hash_head; check_symbol != NULL;
00351        check_symbol = check_symbol->next_hash)
00352     {
00353       /* Check hash value and array_length before doing char_array compare to
00354        * minimize overhead.
00355        */
00356       if ((check_symbol->hash_val == hash_val) &&
00357           (check_symbol->array_length == array_length))
00358         {
00359           /* Determine if char_arrays really do match */
00360           match = 1;
00361           for (i = 0; i < array_length; i++)
00362             {
00363               if (check_symbol->char_array[i] != char_array[i])
00364                 {
00365                   match = 0;
00366                   break;
00367                 }
00368             }
00369 
00370           if (match)
00371             {
00372               fprintf (stderr, "%s: Cannot add char array:\n", table->name);
00373               fprintf (stderr, "  (%02x", char_array[0]);
00374               for (i = 1; i < array_length; i++)
00375                 fprintf (stderr, " %02x", char_array[i]);
00376               fprintf (stderr, ")\n");
00377               I_punt ("   CHAR_ARRAY_add_symbol: "
00378                       "char array already in table!");
00379             }
00380         }
00381     }
00382 
00383 
00384   /* Add symbol to head of linked list */
00385   symbol->next_hash = hash_head;
00386   symbol->prev_hash = NULL;
00387   if (hash_head != NULL)
00388     hash_head->prev_hash = symbol;
00389   table->hash[hash_index] = symbol;
00390 
00391   /* Update table's symbol count */
00392   table->symbol_count = symbol_count + 1;
00393 
00394   /* Return symbol added */
00395   return (symbol);
00396 }
00397 
00398 /* Returns a CHAR_ARRAY_Symbol structure with the desired char_array, or NULL
00399  * if the char_array does not match something in the symbol table.
00400  */
00401 CHAR_ARRAY_Symbol *
00402 CHAR_ARRAY_find_symbol (CHAR_ARRAY_Symbol_Table * table,
00403                         char *char_array, int array_length)
00404 {
00405   CHAR_ARRAY_Symbol *symbol;
00406   unsigned int hash_val, hash_index;
00407   int match, i;
00408 
00409   /* Sanity check, array_length must be >= 1 */
00410   if (array_length < 1)
00411     {
00412       I_punt ("CHAR_ARRAY_find_symbol: Error array_length (%i) < 1!",
00413               array_length);
00414     }
00415 
00416   /* Get the hash value for the char_array */
00417   hash_val = CHAR_ARRAY_hash_char_array (char_array, array_length);
00418 
00419   /* Get the index into the hash table */
00420   hash_index = hash_val & table->hash_mask;
00421 
00422   /* Search the linked list for a matching char_array */
00423   for (symbol = table->hash[hash_index]; symbol != NULL;
00424        symbol = symbol->next_hash)
00425     {
00426       /* Check hash value and array_length before doing char_array compare to
00427        * minimize overhead.
00428        */
00429       if ((symbol->hash_val == hash_val) &&
00430           (symbol->array_length == array_length))
00431         {
00432           /* Determine if char_array really does match */
00433           match = 1;
00434           for (i = 0; i < array_length; i++)
00435             {
00436               if (symbol->char_array[i] != char_array[i])
00437                 {
00438                   match = 0;
00439                   break;
00440                 }
00441             }
00442           if (match)
00443             {
00444               return (symbol);
00445             }
00446         }
00447     }
00448 
00449   return (NULL);
00450 }
00451 
00452 /* 
00453  * Returns the data for desired char_array, or NULL
00454  * if the char_array is not in the symbol table.
00455  */
00456 void *
00457 CHAR_ARRAY_find_symbol_data (CHAR_ARRAY_Symbol_Table * table,
00458                              char *char_array, int array_length)
00459 {
00460   CHAR_ARRAY_Symbol *symbol;
00461   unsigned int hash_val, hash_index;
00462   int i, match;
00463 
00464   /* Sanity check, array_length must be >= 1 */
00465   if (array_length < 1)
00466     {
00467       I_punt ("CHAR_ARRAY_find_symbol_data: Error array_length (%i) < 1!",
00468               array_length);
00469     }
00470 
00471   /* Get the hash value for the char_array */
00472   hash_val = CHAR_ARRAY_hash_char_array (char_array, array_length);
00473 
00474   /* Get the index into the hash table */
00475   hash_index = hash_val & table->hash_mask;
00476 
00477   /* Search the linked list for matching char_array */
00478   for (symbol = table->hash[hash_index]; symbol != NULL;
00479        symbol = symbol->next_hash)
00480     {
00481       /* Check hash value and array_length before doing char_array compare to
00482        * minimize overhead.
00483        */
00484       if ((symbol->hash_val == hash_val) &&
00485           (symbol->array_length == array_length))
00486         {
00487           /* Determine if char_array really does match */
00488           match = 1;
00489           for (i = 0; i < array_length; i++)
00490             {
00491               if (symbol->char_array[i] != char_array[i])
00492                 {
00493                   match = 0;
00494                   break;
00495                 }
00496             }
00497           if (match)
00498             {
00499               return (symbol->data);
00500             }
00501         }
00502     }
00503 
00504   return (NULL);
00505 }
00506 
00507 /* Deletes symbol and optionally deletes the data using the free routine */
00508 void
00509 CHAR_ARRAY_delete_symbol (CHAR_ARRAY_Symbol * symbol,
00510                           void (*free_routine) (void *))
00511 {
00512   CHAR_ARRAY_Symbol_Table *table;
00513   CHAR_ARRAY_Symbol *next_hash, *prev_hash, *next_symbol, *prev_symbol;
00514   unsigned int hash_index;
00515 
00516   /* Get the table the symbol is from */
00517   table = symbol->table;
00518 
00519   /* Get the hash index from the symbol's hash_val */
00520   hash_index = symbol->hash_val & table->hash_mask;
00521 
00522   /* Remove symbol from hash table */
00523   prev_hash = symbol->prev_hash;
00524   next_hash = symbol->next_hash;
00525   if (prev_hash == NULL)
00526     table->hash[hash_index] = next_hash;
00527   else
00528     prev_hash->next_hash = next_hash;
00529 
00530   if (next_hash != NULL)
00531     next_hash->prev_hash = prev_hash;
00532 
00533   /* Remove symbol from symbol list */
00534   prev_symbol = symbol->prev_symbol;
00535   next_symbol = symbol->next_symbol;
00536   if (prev_symbol == NULL)
00537     table->head_symbol = next_symbol;
00538   else
00539     prev_symbol->next_symbol = next_symbol;
00540 
00541   if (next_symbol == NULL)
00542     table->tail_symbol = prev_symbol;
00543   else
00544     next_symbol->prev_symbol = prev_symbol;
00545 
00546 
00547   /* If free routine specified, free symbol data */
00548   if (free_routine != NULL)
00549     free_routine (symbol->data);
00550 
00551 
00552   /* Free symbol structure and char_array */
00553   free (symbol->char_array);
00554   L_free (CHAR_ARRAY_Symbol_pool, symbol);
00555 
00556   /* Decrement table symbol count */
00557   table->symbol_count--;
00558 }
00559 
00560 
00561 /* Prints out the symbol table's hash table (debug routine) */
00562 void
00563 CHAR_ARRAY_print_symbol_table_hash (FILE * out,
00564                                     CHAR_ARRAY_Symbol_Table * table)
00565 {
00566   CHAR_ARRAY_Symbol *symbol;
00567   int hash_index, lines, i;
00568 
00569   /* Count lines used in table */
00570   lines = 0;
00571   for (hash_index = 0; hash_index < table->hash_size; hash_index++)
00572     {
00573       if (table->hash[hash_index] != NULL)
00574         lines++;
00575     }
00576   fprintf (out, "%s has %i entries (hash size %i, used %i):\n",
00577            table->name, table->symbol_count, table->hash_size, lines);
00578 
00579   /* For each hash_index in hash table */
00580   for (hash_index = 0; hash_index < table->hash_size; hash_index++)
00581     {
00582       /* Skip empty lines */
00583       if (table->hash[hash_index] == NULL)
00584         continue;
00585 
00586       fprintf (out, "%4i:", hash_index);
00587       for (symbol = table->hash[hash_index]; symbol != NULL;
00588            symbol = symbol->next_hash)
00589         {
00590           fprintf (out, "(%02x", symbol->char_array[0]);
00591           for (i = 1; i < symbol->array_length; i++)
00592             fprintf (out, " %02x", symbol->char_array[i]);
00593           fprintf (out, ") ");
00594         }
00595       fprintf (out, "\n");
00596     }
00597 }
